{{COI|date=September 2015}} {{Infobox person | name = Dave Crenshaw | image = Dave Crenshaw.jpg | image_size = | alt = Dave Crenshaw | caption = Dave Crenshaw in September 2012 | birth_date = 1975 | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = American | alma_mater = {{nowrap|[[Brigham Young University]]}} | occupation = Writer, Speaker | known_for = Writing, Time Management | notable_works = ''The Myth of Multitasking'',
''Invaluable'' | style = Interactive, Humorous | influences = | influenced = | awards = | website = [http://davecrenshaw.com www.DaveCrenshaw.com] }} '''Dave Crenshaw''' (born 1975) is an American author, public speaker, [[small business]] and [[time management]] expert.{{cite news |url=http://www.deseretnews.com/article/700251131/Myth-debunks-multitasking.html |title=Book review: 'Myth' debunks multitasking |author=Dennis Lythgoe |publisher=''Jim M. Wall'' |newspaper=''[[Deseret News]]'' |date=August 17, 2008 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/2009/10/08/ban-blackberrys-meetings-leadership-blackberry.html |title=Ban BlackBerrys! |author=Mark Lewis |publisher=''Forbes publishing'' |magazine=''[[Forbes]]'' |date=October 8, 2009 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-11035055 |title=Is multi-tasking a myth? > How best to 'multi-task' |publisher=''[[BBC News]]'' |date=August 20, 2010 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://au.lifestyle.yahoo.com/marie-claire/features/reports/article/-/9514017/could-you-go-a-week-without-multitasking/ |title=Could You Go A Week Without Multitasking? |publisher=''Groupe Marie Claire (France), [[Hearst Corporation]] (US) and [[IPC Media]] (UK)'' |magazine=''[[Marie Claire]]'' |date=May 25, 2011 |accessdate=August 7, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029203340/http://au.lifestyle.yahoo.com/marie-claire/features/reports/article/-/9514017/could-you-go-a-week-without-multitasking/ |archivedate=October 29, 2013 |df= }}{{cite news |url=http://www.ksl.com/?nid=148&sid=26018297 |title=Want to be productive? Stop multitasking |author=Candice Madsen |publisher=''[[KSL-TV|KSL.com]] >> [[Utah]]'' |date=July 15, 2013 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} His books ''The Myth of Multitasking: How "Doing It All" Gets Nothing Done'' and ''Invaluable: The Secret to Becoming Irreplaceable'' have been adapted for teaching by some universities and cited or referenced in the works of some writers.{{cite web |url=http://hrweb.berkeley.edu/learning/career-development/self-assessment/six-factors |title=Self-Assessment: The Six Invaluable Factors |publisher=''[[University of California, Berkeley|Human Resources at UC Berkeley]]'' |accessdate=August 7, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131009084726/http://hrweb.berkeley.edu/learning/career-development/self-assessment/six-factors |archivedate=October 9, 2013 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://jpkc.whut.edu.cn/ppkc/course/coursepage/coursepage.aspx?menuid=11&menuitemid=24&menuitemitemid=348 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029205738/http://jpkc.whut.edu.cn/ppkc/course/coursepage/coursepage.aspx?menuid=11&menuitemid=24&menuitemitemid=348 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=October 29, 2013 |title=Case&Exercises |publisher=''[[Wuhan University of Technology|Modern Education Technology Center at WHUT]]'' |accessdate=August 7, 2013 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.reg.msu.edu/Read/PDF/2012%20aacrao_take_charge_of_your_day.pdf |title=Take Charge of Your Day and Achieve Professional Growth Along the Way |author=Nicole Rovig |publisher=''[[Michigan State University|Office of the Registrar at MSU]]'' |pages=12 and 21 |year=2012 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite news |url=http://www.stylist.co.uk/stylist-network/the-great-multitasking-myth#image-rotator-1 |title=The Great Multitasking Myth |author=Laura Jane Macbeth (words) |author2=Rex Features (photos) |magazine=''[[Stylist (magazine)|Stylist Magazine]]'' |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/carol-j-scott-md/multitasking-brain_b_2803871.html |title=From Multi-Tasking to Mindful-Tasking |author=Carol J. Scott |publisher=''[[The Huffington Post]]'' |date=May 3, 2013 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} ==Background== Crenshaw earned his Bachelor of Science in Business Management with emphasis in Entrepreneurship from the [[Marriott School of Management]] at [[Brigham Young University]] in 2000.{{cite web |url=http://marriottschool.byu.edu/marriottmag/winter09/alumni/class_notes.cfm#2000 |title=Winter 2009 > Class Notes > 2000 |publisher=''[[Marriott School of Management#Alumni|Marriott School]] at [[Brigham Young University]]'' |magazine=''Marriott Alumni Magazine'' |year=2009 |accessdate=August 7, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130709042000/https://marriottschool.byu.edu/marriottmag/winter09/alumni/class_notes.cfm#2000 |archivedate=July 9, 2013 |df= }} A clinical psychologist once diagnosed Crenshaw with [[attention deficit hyperactivity disorder]] (ADHD).{{cite web |url=http://www.smallgiants.org/myth-multitasking-feature-interview-dave-crenshaw/ |title=The Myth of Multitasking: Feature Interview with Dave Crenshaw |publisher=''Inc. Small Giants Community'' |date=March 7, 2013 |accessdate=August 7, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130504195224/http://www.smallgiants.org/myth-multitasking-feature-interview-dave-crenshaw/ |archivedate=May 4, 2013 |df= }} According to Cathy Allred in the [[Daily Herald (Utah)|Daily Herald]] of [[Utah]], Crenshaw was able to harness his own chaos and through his career choice as a business coach, has helped others manage time well through coaching and [[self-help book]]s dealing with [[time management]] and [[productivity]].{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldextra.com/news/local/north/lehi/harness-chaos-build-boundaries-lehi-resident-says/article_3eea6e73-0a02-5f3f-bd60-e3e0095c7ad0.html |title=Harness chaos, build boundaries, Lehi resident says |author=Cathy Allred |publisher=''Rona Rahlf'' |newspaper=''[[Daily Herald (Utah)|Daily Herald]], [[Utah]]'' |date=March 25, 2012 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} ==Career== Crenshaw began his career in 1998 as an independent consultant for a large consulting firm for [[small business]]es. He is also a [[Lynda Weinman|Lynda.com's]] author and presenter of over 10 business skills courses, including "Time Management Fundamentals" and "Small Business Secrets".{{cite web |url=http://directory.espeakers.com/nsas/viewspeaker19779 |title=Dave Crenshaw |publisher=''[[National Speakers Association]]'' |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://www.lynda.com/Dave-Crenshaw/955602-1.html |title=Author > Dave Crenshaw |publisher=''[[Lynda Weinman|Lynda.com]]'' |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://marriottschool.byu.edu/marriottmag/summer11/alumni/class_notes.cfm#2000 |title=Summer 2011 > Class Notes > 2000 |publisher=''[[Marriott School of Management#Alumni|Marriott School]] at [[Brigham Young University]]'' |magazine=''Marriott Alumni Magazine'' |year=2011 |accessdate=August 7, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130709002738/https://marriottschool.byu.edu/marriottmag/summer11/alumni/class_notes.cfm#2000 |archivedate=July 9, 2013 |df= }} The [[BBC News]] described Crenshaw as a multitasking expert, and wrote that Crenshaw says that to be productive it is best not to multi-task at all. Crenshaw is described by Mark Lewis in [[Forbes]] as a productivity consultant, and wrote that Crenshaw says that multitaskers think they are doing two or more things simultaneously, when actually they are switching rapidly back and forth between tasks. Joyce E.A. Russell wrote in ''[[The Washington Post]]'' that Crenshaw says that multitasking should be called switchtasking because if you really examined what you are doing you would see that people are just rapidly switching from one task to another, and as we are not very good at it, it can have some consequences, actually hurting our [[productivity]] because of the time lost making even fast switches.{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2011/01/28/AR2011012805971.html |title=Career coach: Move beyond the multi-tasking badge |author=Joyce E.A. Russell |publisher=''[[Katharine Weymouth]]'' |newspaper=''[[The Washington Post]]'' |date=January 31, 2011 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} ''The Myth of Multitasking: How "Doing It All" Gets Nothing Done'' was written by Crenshaw and published in 2008 by Jossey-Bass, an imprint of [[John Wiley & Sons|Wiley]].{{cite book |url=http://lccn.loc.gov/2008014797 |title=The Myth of Multitasking: How "Doing It All" Gets Nothing Done |author=Dave Crenshaw |publisher=[[John Wiley & Sons#Brands and partnerships|Jossey-Bass]] |location=San Francisco |edition=1st |isbn=9780470372258 |page=138 p. : ill. |nopp=yes |year=c. 2008 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite news |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1846739,00.html |title=Business Books |author=Andrea Sachs |magazine=''[[Time (magazine)|Time Magazine]]'' |date=October 2, 2008 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite news |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/report-on-business/a-road-map-for-selling-soap-on-the-information-highway/article955737/ |title= A road map for selling soap on the information highway |author=Harvey Schachter |publisher=''Phillip Crawley'' |newspaper=''[[The Globe and Mail]]'' |date=October 1, 2008 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} Dennis Lythgoe described ''The Myth of Multitasking: How "Doing It All" Gets Nothing Done'' in the [[Deseret News]] as a candid and [[Satire|satirical]] little book that takes on one of the most talked about social [[Mythology|myths]] of the modern scene – multitasking. [[John Wiley & Sons#Brands and partnerships|Jossey-Bass]] also published Crenshaw's book, ''Invaluable: The Secret to Becoming Irreplaceable'' in 2010.{{cite book |url=http://lccn.loc.gov/2009051939 |title=Invaluable: The Secret to Becoming Irreplaceable |author=Dave Crenshaw |publisher=[[John Wiley & Sons#Brands and partnerships|Jossey-Bass]] |location=San Francisco |edition=1st |isbn=9780470553237 |page=166 p. : ill. |nopp=yes |year=c. 2010 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite news |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/report-on-business/competent-just-doesnt-cut-it-any-more/article1717304/ |title=Competent just doesn't cut it any more |author=Harvey Schachter |publisher=''Phillip Crawley'' |newspaper=''[[The Globe and Mail]]'' |date=September 21, 2010 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} Jim Pawlak summarized ''Invaluable: The Secret to Becoming Irreplaceable'' in the [[American City Business Journals#Newspapers|Silicon Valley Business Journal]] that Crenshaw provides a number of fill-in-the-blanks templates that help you identify your most valuable activities (MVAs) and manage time effectively.{{cite news |url=http://www.bizjournals.com/sanjose/print-edition/2011/02/04/two-paths-to-becoming-your-companys-MVP.html |title=Two paths to becoming your company's most valuable player |author=Jim Pawlak |publisher=''[[Advance Publications]]'' |newspaper=''[[American City Business Journals#Newspapers|Silicon Valley Business Journal]]'' |date=February 4, 2011 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} Crenshaw's book on [[entrepreneurship]], ''The Focused Business: How Entrepreneurs Can Triumph Over Chaos'' was published in 2013.{{cite book |url=http://lccn.loc.gov/2013937187 |title=The Focused Business: How Entrepreneurs Can Triumph Over Chaos |author=Dave Crenshaw |publisher=Invaluable Press |location=[[Lehi, Utah|Lehi, UT]] |edition=1st |isbn=9780989193603 |page=204 p. : ill. |nopp=yes |year=c. 2013 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=RonCmgEACAAJ |title=The Focused Business: How Entrepreneurs Can Triumph Over Chaos |author=Dave Crenshaw |publisher=''Invaluable Press'' |location=[[Lehi, Utah|Lehi, UT]] |year=2013 |accessdate=August 7, 2013|isbn=9780989193603 }} Crenshaw has been a [[Keynote|keynote speaker]] for many small business events, including [[Entrepreneurs' Organization|EO]] Alchemy 2012 — [[Seattle]],{{cite web |url=http://www.soapqueen.com/business/switchtasking/ |title=Switchtasking |author=Anne-Marie |publisher=''Soap Queen'' |date=December 2, 2012 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} Crown Council's 18th Annual Event,{{cite web |url=http://hammondellis.com/2013/02/why-were-we-in-nashville/ |title=Why Were We in Nashville? |publisher=''Hammond and Ellis Dentistry'' |date=February 28, 2013 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} Schnizzfest 2013,{{cite web |url=http://mspmentor.net/your-business/improving-productivity-why-your-time-management-system-doesnt-work |title=Improving Productivity: Why Your Time Management System Doesn't Work |author=Jessica Davis |publisher=''MSPmentor by [[Cat Lewis#Current career|Nine Lives Media]], a division of [[Penton Media]]'' |date=June 25, 2013 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} Behind Every Leader,{{cite web|url=https://www.behindeveryleader.com/dave-crenshaw.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130807131721/https://www.behindeveryleader.com/dave-crenshaw.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=August 7, 2013 |title=Dave Crenshaw |publisher=''Behind Every Leader by Executive Assistants Organization (EAO)'' |accessdate=August 7, 2013 }} TiE [[Silicon Valley]] and LTB 2014.{{cite web |last= Bree|first= Abraham|url=http://ptexgroup.com/blog/2014/07/06/okay-mr-crenshaw-ive-got-back/ |title=It’s Okay Mr. Crenshaw, I’ve Got Your Back |publisher=Ptex Group |date= July 6, 2014| accessdate=November 19, 2014}} ==Publications== Some of the books written by Crenshaw are: * {{cite book |url=http://lccn.loc.gov/2008014797 |title=The Myth of Multitasking: How "Doing It All" Gets Nothing Done |author=Dave Crenshaw |publisher=[[John Wiley & Sons#Brands and partnerships|Jossey-Bass]] |location=San Francisco |edition=1st |isbn=9780470372258 |page=138 p. : ill. |nopp=yes |year=c. 2008 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} * {{cite book |url=http://lccn.loc.gov/2009051939 |title=Invaluable: The Secret to Becoming Irreplaceable |author=Dave Crenshaw |publisher=[[John Wiley & Sons#Brands and partnerships|Jossey-Bass]] |location=San Francisco |edition=1st |isbn=9780470553237 |page=166 p. : ill. |nopp=yes |year=c. 2010 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}} * {{cite book |url=http://lccn.loc.gov/2013937187 |title=The Focused Business: How Entrepreneurs Can Triumph Over Chaos |author=Dave Crenshaw |publisher=Invaluable Press |location=[[Lehi, Utah|Lehi, UT]] |edition=1st |isbn=9780989193603 |page=204 p. : ill. |nopp=yes |year=c. 2013 |accessdate=August 7, 2013}}{{cite book |url=http://www.enguerrand.net/livre-entrepreneur/ |title=Entrepreneurs, le livre de votre été : The Focused Business | accessdate=November 19, 2014}} ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== * [http://davecrenshaw.com Official website] {{Authority control}} {{Infobox person |name = Dmitry Gerasimenko |residence = |othernames = |image = Dmitrij Gerasimenko - 2016.jpg |imagesize = 200 |caption = |birthname = |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1978|9|29}} |birth_place = |deathdate = |deathplace = |deathcause = |almamater = |yearsactive = |known = Owner of [[Krasny Oktyabr Closed Joint-Stock Company]], [[BC Krasny Oktyabr]] and [[Pallacanestro Cantù]]. |nationality = [[Russia]]n |title = |salary = |term = |predecessor = |successor = |party = |boards = |religion = |spouse = |networth = |partner = |children = |parents = |relations = |website = |footnotes = |employer = |height = |weight = }} '''Dmitry Petrovich Gerasimenko''' ({{lang-ru|Дмитрий Петрович Герасименко}}; born 29 September 1978) is a [[Russia]]n businessman, owner of steel company [[Krasny Oktyabr Closed Joint-Stock Company]] and of basketball clubs [[BC Krasny Oktyabr]] and [[Pallacanestro Cantù]].
== Biography ==
Of [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] origin, Gerasimenko became a multimillionaire thanks to steel (actually he owns [[Krasny Oktyabr Closed Joint-Stock Company]], the second largest steelmill in [[Russia]]) and gas.<ref name="panorama">{{cite news|url=http://www.panorama.it/sport/basket/chi-e-dmitry-gerasimenko-nuovo-proprietario-della-pallacanestro-cantu/|title=Chi è Dmitry Gerasimenko, nuovo proprietario della Pallacanestro Cantù|author=Paolo Corio|publisher=[[Panorama (magazine)|Panorama]]|date=2015-11-06|language=Italian|access-date=2015-12-19}}</ref><ref name="canfora">{{cite news|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Basket/12-02-2015/basket-presidente-re-dell-acciaio-russo-va-campo-eurocup-100860317331.shtml|title=Basket: il presidente, re dell’acciaio russo, va in campo in Eurocup!|author=Mario Canfora|publisher=[[La Gazzetta dello Sport]]|date=2015-02-12|language=Italian|access-date=2015-12-20}}</ref>
In 2012 he founded the [[BC Krasny Oktyabr|club of the same name of the factory]], who got a wild card for the [[VTB United League]].<ref name="canfora"/>
In November 2015 has also acquired 65% of the shares of [[Pallacanestro Cantù]].<ref name="panorama"/>

revision.text:
'''Doubling''' is a [[textile]] industry term synonymous with combining. It can be used for various processes during [[spinning (textiles)|spinning]]. During the carding stage, several sources of [[roving]] are doubled together and drawn, to remove variations in thickness. After spinning, yarn is doubled for many reasons. Yarn may be doubled to produce warp for weaving, to make cotton for lace, crochet and knitting. {{sfn|Naismith|1896|p=557}} It is used for embroidery threads and [[sewing thread]]s, for example: sewing thread is usually 6-cable thread. Two threads of spun [[cotton count|60s cotton]] are twisted together, and three of these double threads are twisted into a cable, of what is now 5s yarn. This is [[mercerised cotton|mercerised]], [[Gassing (textile process)|gassed]] (AKA flamed) and [[wound]] onto a bobbin. {{sfn|Naismith|1896|p=567}}
==Processing of cotton== {{Cotton processing flowchart}} ===Doubling in the carding process===
In a wider sense carding can refer to the four processes of [[willowing]], lapping, [[carding]] and drawing. During willowing the fibres are loosened; in lapping the dust is removed to create a flat sheet or lap of fibres. Carding combs the tangled lap into a thick rope or sliver of 1/2 inch in diameter, and removes the shorter fibres creating a stronger yarn.
During the carding process the staples are separated and then assembled into a loose strand (sliver or tow). The carders line up the staples to prepare them for spinning. The carding machine consists mainly of one big roller with smaller ones surrounding it. All of the rollers are covered in small teeth, and as the cotton progresses further on the teeth get finer (i.e. closer together). The cotton leaves the carding machine in the form of a sliver; a large rope of fibres.<ref>{{Harvnb|Collier |1970|pp=66,67}}</ref>''
In drawing, 4 slivers are combined into one. Repeated drawing decreases the quality of the sliver drastically, disabling finer counts from being spun.<ref>{{Harvnb|Collier |1970|p=69}}</ref> Each sliver will have thin and thick spots. By combining, or doubling several slivers together a more consistent size can be reached. The slivers are separated into rovings. These rovings (or slubbings) are then what are used in the spinning process. <ref>{{Harvnb|Collier |1970|pp=70}}</ref>
For machine processing, a roving is about the width of a pencil. The rovings are collected in a drum and proceed to the '''slubbing frame''' which adds twist, and winds onto bobbins. '''Intermediate Frames''' are used to repeat the slubbing process to produce a finer yarn, and then the '''roving frames''' reduces it to a finer thread, gives more twist, makes more regular and even in thickness, and winds onto a smaller tube.<ref>{{Harvnb|Hills|1993|p=4}}</ref>
[[File:Masson Mills WTM 20 Derby Doubler 1902 Platts 5907.JPG|thumb|left|Derby Doubler:Masson Mills]] Over time the processes were refined. At [[Masson Mill]] and at [[Helmshore Mills Textile Museum|Helmshore]], there are Derby Doublers. The Masson machine, built by Platts of Oldham in 1902, doubled rovings from the breaker cards into card lap. This was then passed through the finisher card to produce the rovings <ref>[http://www.massonmills.co.uk/Museum/M/form.html.php?linknam=Derby_Doubler Masson Mill Derby Doubler]</ref> This process was known as double carding. The Derby Doubler was patented by [[Evan Leigh]] of Ashton-under-Lyne (21 December 1810 - 2 February 1876) and, though superseded, still continued in service in condensing coarse counts.<ref>[http://oneguyfrombarlick.co.uk/viewtopic.php?f=359&t=7270 One guy from Barlick: Evan Leigh and the Derby Doubler] Stanley Graham</ref>
===The doubling process=== Doubling of yarn where two or more stands or ends of yarn are twisted together. There are many purposes where doubled yarn is used. Sometimes thread is doubled to make warp, and it is invariably used for the manufacture of knitting yarn, crochet yarn and sewing yarn. All these yarns must be smooth and free from knots. In a sewing thread, the treads are doubled in two phases. Two or three strands are twisted together then three of these threads are twisted together, to form a six or nine cord.{{sfn|Naismith|1896|pp=58}} The spun yarn is wound onto a bobbin using a ''doubling winding machine'', and two or more of these bobbins are placed on doubling frame (doubling winding machine). The ends pass through a series of rollers and twisted together onto one bobbin using a spindle and flyer. The process here is similar to that found in one of Arkwrights [[Water frame]]s, though the size of the ring, spindle and traveller are predictably larger. Alternatively a 'twiner' is used: this is a modified spinning mule and is mainly consigned to the doubling of warp thread {{sfn|Naismith|1896|p=564}} High quality doubling depended on keeping the tension correct and feeding the produced thread evenly and tightly on a bobbin or flangeless paper tubes {{sfn|Naismith|1896|p=562}} <gallery> Masson Mills WTM 6 Doubling 5852.JPG Masson Mills WTM 6 Doubling 5851.JPG Masson Mills WTM 6 Doubling 5853.JPG </gallery>
== See also == * [[Fine Cotton Spinners and Doublers Association]], a major UK cotton spinning company

Hills |title=Power from Steam: A History of the Stationary Steam Engine |publisher=Cambridge University Press, |year=1993 |pages=244|isbn=978-0-521-45834-4 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=t6TLOQBhd0YC|accessdate=January 2009}}

{{Globalize/US|date=March 2011}}
'''Employment testing''' is the practice of administering written, oral, or other [[Test (student assessment)|tests]] as a means of determining the suitability or desirability of a job applicant. The premise is that if scores on a test correlate with [[job performance]], then it is economically useful for the employer to select employees based on scores from that test.
== Legal context (United States) ==
The [[United States Supreme Court]] has decided several cases clarifying the place of employment testing in the context of discrimination law. In particular, these cases have addressed the discriminatory use of tests when promoting employees by requiring tests beyond the education required for the job. A central finding in [[Griggs v. Duke Power Co.]] was that the employer must demonstrate (or be prepared to demonstrate) that its selection process is related to the job being filled.<ref>Griggs v. Duke Power Co. :401 U.S. 424 (1971)</ref>
== Test types used ==
Different types of assessments may be used for employment testing, including personality tests, intelligence tests, work samples, and assessment centers. Some correlate better with job performance than with others; employers often use more than one to maximize predictive power.
=== Performance assessment tests === Performance-based assessment testing is a process to find out if applicants can do the job for which they are applying. It is done through tests, which are directly administered and judged by Hiring Managers who will be supervising the potential hire. Performance assessments can be used as a pre-screening tool to test applied knowledge, skills-job match and commitment of the applicant towards the job position.<ref>Imperica. [http://www.imperica.com/features/into-the-gap "Into the Gap"], March 20, 2012</ref>
The tests are peer-to-peer and reflect real business tasks that candidates have to perform, should they be selected for the role. The tests are open ended, time bound, business related questions which applicants need to submit their responses for in order to prove their abilities.<ref>New Empire Builders: Discover Startups, Nonprofits, + Companies making the world better. [http://www.newempirebuilders.com/2012/07/10/bridging-the-gap-between-college-and-the-real-world/ "Bridging the Gap between College and the Real World"], July 10, 2012</ref>
The most important question that performance testing, seeks to answer is: How would you solve this problem?<ref>Lou Adler. [http://www.linkedin.com/today/post/article/20130228212434-15454-the-complete-2-question-interview?trk=prof-post "The Complete 2-Question Interview"], The Essential Guide for Hiring & Getting Hired, ASIN B00B9JZMKE.</ref> Web tools like, HireVue,<ref>Techcrunch. [https://techcrunch.com/2012/08/30/hirevue-lands-22-million-to-reinvent-the-job-interview/ "Reinvent The Job Interview"], August 30, 2012.</ref> GapJumpers<ref>Imperica. [http://www.imperica.com/features/into-the-gap "Assessment tool for the social era"], March 20, 2012.</ref> and CodeEval<ref>The Next Web. [https://thenextweb.com/apps/2010/08/20/codeeval-a-unique-approach-to-hiring-your-next-code-writer "A unique approach to hiring your next coder"], August 20, 2010.</ref> allow candidate responses to be judged directly by Hiring Managers of the respective departments to select the ones most suited for the role, thus making the process efficient for the company.
=== Personality tests === [[Personality test]]s may potentially be useful in personnel selection. Of the well-known [[Big Five personality traits]], only conscientiousness correlates substantially with traditional measures of job performance, and that correlation is strong enough to be predictive.<ref>Barrick, M. R., & Mount, M. K. (1991). The big five personality dimensions and job performance: A meta-analysis. ''Personnel Psychology'', ''44'', 1-26.</ref> However, other factors of personality can correlate substantially with non-traditional aspects of job performance, such as leadership and effectiveness in a team environment.<ref>Hogan, R. (2006). ''Personality and the fate of organizations.''</ref> The [[Myers-Briggs Type Indicator]] (MBTI) is also used.
The [[Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory]] (MMPI) is a highly validated psychopathology test that is generally used in a clinical psychology setting and may reveal potential mental health disorders.<ref>[http://psychcorp.pearsonassessments.com/HAIWEB/Cultures/en-us/Productdetail.htm?Pid=MMPI-2&Mode=summary Official MMPI-2 Description]</ref> However, this can be considered by the [[Equal Employment Opportunity Commission]] as the employer having knowledge of a medical condition prior to an offer of employment. This is an illegal basis for a hiring decision in the United States. Employers considering [[personality tests]] should focus on tests designed for job purposes and do not provide any information regarding an applicant's mental health or stability.
Notable situations in which the MMPI may be used are in final selection for police officers, fire fighters, and other security and emergency personnel, especially when the employees are required to carry weapons. An assessment of mental stability and fitness can be reasonably related and necessary in the performance of the job.
[[Employment integrity testing]] is used to determine an applicant's [[honesty]] and [[integrity]].<ref name="U.S. Congress">{{cite web | title=The Use of Integrity Tests for Pre-Employment Screening | publisher=Office of Technology Assessment | date=1990 | accessdate=13 February 2015 | pages=1–78}}</ref>
=== Cognitive ability tests ===
Tests of cognitive ability can assess [[general intelligence]] and correlate very highly with overall job performance.<ref>Schmidt, F.L., & Hunter, J. (2004). General Mental Ability in the World of Work: Occupational Attainment and Job Performance. ''Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 86''(1), 162–173.[http://www.psychology.org.nz/industrial/Schmidt%20and%20Hunter%20(2004).pdf]</ref> Individuals with higher levels of cognitive ability tend to perform better on their jobs. This is especially true for jobs that are particularly intellectually demanding.
=== Job-knowledge tests ===
Employers administer job-knowledge tests when applicants must already possess a body of knowledge before being hired.<ref>[[Office of Personnel Management|U.S. Office of Personnel Management]] [http://apps.opm.gov/ADT/Content.aspx?page=3-07 "Assessment Decision Guide"]. Retrieved on 2008-08-14.</ref> Job-knowledge tests are particularly useful when applicants must have specialized or technical knowledge that can only be acquired through extensive experience or training. Job-knowledge tests are commonly used in fields such as computer programming, law, financial management.and electrical or mechanical maintenance.
Licensing exams and certification programs are also types of job-knowledge tests. Passing such exams indicates competence in the exam's subject area. Tests must be representative of the tested field, otherwise litigation can be brought against the test-giver.
=== Situational judgment tests ===
Situational judgment tests are commonly used as employee-selection and employee-screening tools and have been developed to predict employment success.<ref>Ployhart, R. E. (2006). Staffing in the 21st century: New challenges and strategic opportunities. ''Journal of Management'', ''32'', 868-897.</ref> These tests present realistic hypothetical scenarios in a multiple-choice format. Applicants are asked to state what they would do in a difficult job-related situation.<ref>Lievens, F., Peeters, H., & Schollaert, E. (2008). Situational judgment tests: A review of recent research. ''Personnel Review'', ''37'', 426-441.</ref>
Situational judgment tests measure the suitability of job applicants by assessing attributes such as problem solving, service orientation, and striving for achievement.<ref>Whetzel, D. L., & McDaniel, M. A. (2009). Situational judgment tests: An overview of current research. ''Human Resource Management Review'', ''19'', 188-202.</ref>
'''Pre-employment testing companies:'''
Below organisations are providing employment testing services to companies & helping them with the employment tests to solve their hiring problems.
*[https://www.hackerrank.com/ HackerRank]
*[https://www.interviewmocha.com/ Interview Mocha] *[https://www.codility.com/ Codility] *[https://www.criteriacorp.com/solution/hireselect_pro.php HireSelect] * eSkill Testing * TestDome * Berke Assessments * Wonderlic * Hirevue * Criteria Corp * EmployTest
== See also == * [[Civil Rights Act of 1964]] * [[Industrial and organizational psychology]] * [[Objective test]] * [[Projective test]] * [[Psychological testing]] * [[Situational judgement test]] * [[Watson v. Fort Worth Bank & Trust]], 487 U.S. 977 (1988) * [[Wards Cove Packing Co. v. Atonio]], 490 U.S. 642, 657 (1989),
== References == {{Reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.siop.org/workplace/employment%20testing/employment_testing_toc.aspx Employment Testing]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Employment Testing}} [[Category:Human resource management]] [[Category:Psychological testing]] [[Category:Labour law]]

'''Evangelos Papastratos''' ({{lang-el|Ευάγγελος Παπαστράτος}}, 1910 – 1973) was a [[Greece|Greek]] [[business]]man born in the city of [[Agrinio]] in [[Aetolia-Acarnania]], [[Greece]].
Although the youngest of his brothers, he was the first in his family to become involved with the [[tobacco]] trade. Along with his brother Sotirios he founded the '''[[Papastratos|Papastratiou Brothers]]''' firm, one of the biggest tobacco companies in [[Greece]] until the rise in foreign cigarette imports in the 1970s and the 1980s. Papastratos also wrote a book called ''I douleia kai o kopos tis'' (''Η δουλειά και ο κόπος της'').
==External links== *[http://www.epoxi.gr/persons2.htm Evangelos Papastratos on ''Nea Epohi'']
{{DEFAULTSORT:Papastratos, Evangelos}} [[Category:1910 births]] [[Category:1973 deaths]] [[Category:Greek businesspeople]] [[Category:Greek philanthropists]] [[Category:People from Agrinio]]
{{Greece-business-bio-stub}}

revision.text:
The '''"Faces of Freedom"''' photo exhibition is a collection of photographs captured by [[photo-journalist]], [[filmmaker]] and [[human rights]] [[educator]] [[Robin Romano|U. Roberto (Robin) Romano]], during his travels to [[India]], [[Nepal]] and [[Pakistan]]. Romano explores the exploitation of [[child labor]] in the production of handmade rugs in coordination with multiple international organizations, such as the [[World Bank]], [[UNICEF]], [[International Labour Organization]] and others to reduce the number of child laborers in that industry. The exhibit has been shown in many United States cities since its first exhibit in 2009. Faces of Freedom has been included in [[CNN]] Freedom Projects of [[Slavery#Contemporary slavery|modern slavery]]. ==Child labor== To combat exploitation of [[Child labour|child labor]], [[The World Bank]] with [[UNICEF]], [[International Labour Organization]] (ILO) and Understanding Children's Work Initiative to bring awareness of the scope of the problem. The World Bank estimates that there are 218 million children who are victim to unfair child labor practices. The children's ages range from five to seventeen years of age. The handmade rug industry is one of industries involved in exploitation of child labor. The World Bank works with country-based and non-governmental organizations (NGOs) in an effort to "combat child labor."{{cite web |url=http://go.worldbank.org/CLQNYOJEE0 |title=Faces of Freedom - Visions of Hope for Child Laborers |author= |date=2009-12-16 |work=Topics, Children and Youth |publisher=The World Bank |accessdate=2011-05-27 }}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The [[United Nations]] and the [[International Labour Organization]] consider child labor exploitative,{{cite web |title=Worst Forms of Child Labor Recommendation, 1999 |work=International Labour Organization |url=http://www.ilo.org/ilolex/cgi-lex/convde.pl?R190 |accessdate=2006-10-05}}{{cite web|title=Convention on the Rights of the Child |work=United Nations |url=http://www.ohchr.org/english/law/crc.htm |accessdate=2006-10-05 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061003230539/http://www.ohchr.org/english/law/crc.htm |archivedate=2006-10-03 |deadurl=yes |df= }} with the UN stipulating, in article 32 of the [[Convention on the Rights of the Child]] that:
''...States Parties recognize the right of the child to be protected from economic exploitation and from performing any work that is likely to be hazardous or to interfere with the child's education, or to be harmful to the child's health or physical, mental, spiritual, moral or social development.'' Although globally there is an estimated 250 million children working.
According to the census in 1990 nearly 18% of all the children in America are working in different organizations. The Supreme Court banned child labor in 1916 but the law became visible in 1941. The labor department is also not paying attention to the child labor in USA therefore children are still employed in the organizations. The age of the children who are employed is between 15 years to 17 years. They are nearly 3.7 million children who work in different factories. There is an interesting fact that more than 600 children died in work related accidents.{{cite news|url=http://www.whatisusa.info/child-labor-in-usa|title=Child Labor in USA|publisher=What is USA News|date=15 April 2013 | accessdate=2012-12-16}} ==Exhibit== U. Roberto Romano, a photographer, filmmaker and humans right activist, traveled to [[India]], [[Nepal]] and [[Pakistan]] to record the plight of child laborers in the handmade rug industry. He also gathered photographs and stories of children who have been rescued by the [[Rugmark|GoodWeave]] organization, previously known as Rugmark.{{cite web |url=http://mediavoicesforchildren.org/?p=55 |title=Rugmark |date=March 3, 2009 |publisher=Media Voices for Children |accessdate=2011-05-27}}{{cite web |url=http://mediavoicesforchildren.org/?page_id=1027 |title=Faces of Freedom |year=2011 |publisher=Media Voices for Children |accessdate=2011-05-27}} The Faces of Freedom exhibit is a collection of photos by U. Roberto Romano that provides insight into the lives, poor living conditions and faces of child rug-weavers of South Asia. Messages of hope are portrayed in the photographs and stories of children that were assisted by the [[Rugmark|GoodWeave]] program to attain school education. A selection of handmade rugs made without child labor is also exhibited.{{cite web|url=http://www.southtexascollege.edu/milagros/virtual_library.html |title=Photographic Documentaries, U. Roberto (Robin) Romano |work=Center of Excellence for Health Professions Development |publisher=South Texas College |accessdate=2011-05-27 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110721173823/http://www.southtexascollege.edu/milagros/virtual_library.html |archivedate=2011-07-21 |df= }} After initial showings in San Francisco, New York and Washington, D.C., the collection has been exhibited in major cities across the United States since 2009.{{cite web |url=http://fieldnotes.unicefusa.org/2009/08/faces_of_freedom_photo_exhibit_1.html |title=Faces of Freedom photo exhibit |author=Kate Weber, UNICEF |year=2011 |work=Field Notes |publisher=United States Fund for UNICEF |accessdate=2011-05-27}}{{cite web |url=http://www.facesoffreedom.goodweave.org/ |title=Past Events |work=Faces of Freedom |publisher=GoodWeave |accessdate=2011-05-27}} ==News media== In late 2010, the Faces of Freedom exhibit was featured the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] [[television network]] show [[Good Morning America]]. On April 18, 2011, Faces of Freedom was covered in CNN Freedom Project’s of [[Slavery#Contemporary slavery|modern slavery]]. The piece appears on [[CNN]] [http://thecnnfreedomproject.blogs.cnn.com/ website] with a slideshow of images of [[Rugmark|GoodWeave’s]] Faces of Freedom photo exhibition. ==Related projects== U. Roberto (Robin) Romano is an investigative filmmaker, where he has been director, director of photography, still photographer and/or producer in the following efforts: '''[[The Harvest (documentary)|The Harvest]]''' :[[The Harvest (documentary)]] is a feature documentary on the life of migrant children and their families in America. It revisits [[Edward R. Murrow]]’s [[Harvest of Shame]], filmed 40 years ago, and reveals that little has changed over the past 4 decades in the lives of migrant farm workers in America. The Harvest, however, is told from a child’s perspective as we meet 4 of the more than 400,000 children between the ages of 5 and 16 who labor in fields and factories to feed us, lacking the protections offered by the Fair Labor Standards Act that all other American children enjoy.{{cite web | url=http://www.shineglobal.org/?page_id=19 | title=The Harvest/La Cosecha, The Story of the Children Who Feed America | publisher=Shine Global | year=2010 | accessdate=2011-05-27 }}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} In 2009, [[Eva Longoria]] signed on as an Executive Producer of the project.{{ cite web | url=http://www.broadcastingcable.com/article/189904-Eva_Longoria_Parker_to_Executive_Produce_Child_Farm_Worker_Documentary.php | title=Eva Longoria Parker to Executive Produce Child Farm Worker Documentary | author=Tanklefsky, D | date=Mar 13, 2009 | publisher=Bay Media, LLC | accessdate=2011-05-27}} The Harvest premiered at the [[International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam|IDFA]] festival in Amsterdam in November 2010{{cite web |url=http://www.idfa.nl/industry/tags/project.aspx?id=e1433bf7-c2fa-4160-806d-b169fdce01aa |title=The Harvest |work=IDFA 2010 |publisher=IDFA |accessdate=2011-05-27 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101126211653/http://www.idfa.nl/industry/tags/project.aspx?id=E1433BF7-C2FA-4160-806D-B169FDCE01AA# |archive-date=2010-11-26 |dead-url=yes |df= }} and will premier in the US in early 2011.{{update inline|date=February 2014}} '''Dark Side of Chocolate''' :A feature documentary, ''[[The Dark Side of Chocolate]]'' explores [[West Africa]]n [[children in cocoa production]]. The 2010 documentary [http://www.thedarksideofchocolate.org ''The Dark Side of Chocolate''] alleged that [[Nestlé]] purchased cocoa beans from [[Ivory Coast]] plantations that use child slave labor. The children are usually 12 to 15 years old, and some are trafficked from nearby countries.{{cite video |people=Romano, U. Roberto & Mistrati, Miki (Directors) |date=16 March 2010 |title=The Dark Side of Chocolate |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1773722 |medium=Television Production |publisher=Bastard Films |location=Denmark |accessdate=28 Apr 2011}} In September 2001, Bradley Alford, Chairman and CEO of [[Nestlé|Nestlé USA]] signed the [[Harkin-Engel Protocol]] (commonly called the Cocoa Protocol), an international agreement aimed at ending child labor in the production of cocoa.{{cite web|url=http://www.cocoainitiative.org/images/stories/pdf/harkin%20engel%20protocol.pdf |title=Protocol for the growing and processing of cocoa beans and their derivative products in a manner that complies with ILO Convention 182 concerning the prohibition and immediate action for the elimination of the worst forms of child labor |publisher=International Cocoa Initiative |year=2001 |accessdate=25 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080724105142/http://www.cocoainitiative.org/images/stories/pdf/harkin%20engel%20protocol.pdf |archivedate=24 July 2008 |df= }} A 2009 joint police operation conducted by [[Interpol]] and Ivorian law enforcement officers resulted in the rescue of 54 children and the arrest of eight people involved in the illegal recruitment of children.{{cite web|url=http://www.interpol.int/Public/News/2009/CotedIvoire20090803.asp |title=Scores of children rescued from organized slave labour in INTERPOL-led operation conducted by Côte d’Ivoire police |publisher=INTERPOL |date=3 Aug 2009 |accessdate=28 Apr 2011 }}{{dead link|date=December 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} '''Fields of Peril''' :Fields in Peril is a 99-page report by [[Human Rights Watch]] about child labor in the United States, the least protected are children who work in agriculture. Labor laws for the agriculture industry, such as minimum age, length of a work day and management of hazardous conditions, are more lenient than those for any other industry.{{cite web |url=https://www.hrw.org/en/reports/2010/05/05/fields-peril-0 |title=Fields of Peril |year=2010 |work=Publications |publisher=Human Rights Watch |accessdate=2011-05-27}}{{cite web |url=https://www.hrw.org/en/video/2010/05/03/fingers-bone-child-farmworkers-us |title=Fingers to the Bone: Child Farmworkers in the US, May 3, 2010 |author=Romano, U. R |year=2010 |work=Multimedia |publisher=Human Rights Watch |accessdate=2011-05-27}} '''Children in the Fields''' :Children in the Fields in an educational documentary produced in 2008 by the Association of Farmworker Opportunity Programs about migrant children working in fields in the United States. Through children, their parents and experts the short documentary explores some of the reasons for child labor exploitation in U.S. agriculture and ways to combat the problem. It was filmed in Minnesota, North Dakota, and Texas.{{cite web |url=http://mediavoicesforchildren.org/?p=217 |title=Children in the Fields |year=2011 |work= |publisher=media voices for children |accessdate=2011-05-27}} '''Stolen Childhoods''' :A feature documentary on global [[child labour|child labor]] exploitation affecting nearly 250 million children. The film, narrated by actress [[Meryl Streep]], covers factors affecting the children: working conditions, slavery, and bonded labor. Children's stories from eight countries, including the United States, tell of children exposed to pesticides, chained to their work areas, and even kidnapped and forced into slavery or prostitution. In addition to providing background for why this occurs and implications to the global community, it also offers hope through stories of children's lives have been saved and what actions can be taken to combat child labor.{{cite web |url=http://www.stolenchildhoods.org/mt/archives/2005/03/full_synopsis.php |title=Stolen Childhoods |author=Chris Mara |date=May 3, 2005 |work=Full Synopsis |publisher=Stolen Childhoods |accessdate=2011-05-27}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://facesoffreedom.goodweave.org/ Official Web-Site for Faces of Freedom] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110517075911/http://www.allvoices.com/contributed-news/9102643-child-slavery-in-the-chocolate-industry Child slavery in the chocolate industry, May 13, 2011] * [http://thecnnfreedomproject.blogs.cnn.com/ CNN Freedom Project to end modern day slavery] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110408045124/http://humanrights.uconn.edu/resources/romano.php University of Connecticut Human Rights Institute, Romano Archives, Digital Photograph Collection] [[Category:Photography exhibitions]] [[Category:Child labour]] [[Category:Children's rights]] [[Category:Labor rights]] [[Category:Slavery]] [[Category:Slavery in the chocolate industry]] [[Category:Human rights abuses]] [[Category:Human rights]]

{{spanish name|Soriano|Compte}} {{Infobox officeholder |name = Ferran Soriano |image = Soriano.JPG |imagesize = 200px |alt = |caption = |order = |office = |term_start = |term_end = |alongside = <!--For two or more people serving in the same position from the same district. (e.g. United States Senators.)--> |predecessor = |successor = |constituency = |majority = |order2 = |office2 = |term_start2 = |term_end2 = |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1967|06|16}} |birth_place = [[Barcelona]], [[Catalonia]], [[Spain]] |death_date = |death_place = |birthname = Ferran Soriano i Compte |nationality = [[Spain|Spanish]] |party = |spouse = |partner = |relations = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = [[Université Catholique de Louvain]], [[Belgium]]. [[MBA]] (1990); [[Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute]], [[New York (state)|New York]]. [[MBA]] (1989); [[ESADE]], [[Barcelona]]. CE+[[MBA]] (1985–1990) |occupation = '''CEO [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] (2012–)''' '''CEO [[New York City FC]] (2014–)''' '''CEO [[Melbourne City FC]] (2014–)''' Previously: '''Chairman at [[Spanair]] (2009–2012)'''; '''Vice-President [[FC Barcelona]] (2003–2008)'''; founding partner of Cluster Consulting '''(1994–2003)''' |profession = |religion = |signature = |signature_alt = |website = |footnotes = }}
'''Ferran Soriano i Compte''' (born June 16, 1967 in [[Barcelona]]) is the Chief Executive Officer of the [[Premier League]]'s [[Manchester City F.C.]], [[Major League Soccer]]'s [[New York City F.C.]], and the [[A-League]]'s [[Melbourne City FC]]. Between 2003 and 2008, he was the Vice-President and General Manager of [[FC Barcelona]].
==Education== Ferran Soriano is an MBA and Business studies graduate at [[ESADE]], the New York [[Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute|RPI]] and [[Université Catholique de Louvain]] of Belgium.
He speaks Catalan, Spanish, English, French and Portuguese.
==Career== Soriano has held a number of positions in companies in a variety of industries, such as consumer products, telecommunications and entertainment, and has held senior positions at The Mac Group, [[Reckitt Benckiser]], and Cluster Consulting, a management consulting firm he co-founded in 1993.
Between 2003 and 2008, Soriano was Economy Vice President of [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], having been elected with the [[Joan Laporta]]’s [[Ticket (election)|ticket]] to the club's [[Board of Directors]]. He also acted as interim CEO. Barcelona's revenues, during Soriano's tenure, increased from €123 million to €308m, while a €73m loss was turned into an €88m profit.<ref name=nat>{{cite news |title=Ferran Soriano is the man to match Manchester City's ambitions |url=http://www.thenational.ae/sport/football/ferran-soriano-is-the-man-to-match-manchester-citys-ambitions |work=[[The National (Abu Dhabi)|The National]] |date=29 August 2012 |accessdate=25 September 2012 }}</ref> On July 6th, 2008, Soriano and seven other Board Members resigned, after a vote of non-confidence against the Board, amidst growing disagreement with Laporta’s "leadership style."
In April 2009, Soriano was elected Chairman of the [[Catalonia]]-based airline [[Spanair]], rescued by the [[Government of Catalonia|Catalan government]] from SAS with the objective of creating a hub in the Barcelona airport. Revenue improved and the company started cutting costs, but, on 27 January 2012, after a deal with [[Qatar Airways]] fell through, the airline ceased operations.<ref name="UPI-Jan28">{{cite web|url= http://www.upi.com/Business_News/2012/01/28/Spanair-shutdown-strands-23000-travelers/UPI-53921327727191/?spt=hs&or=bn|title=Spanair shutdown strands 23,000 travelers |publisher=United Press International |date=January 28, 2012}}</ref>
On 1 September 2012, Soriano was appointed [[Manchester City F.C.]] [[CEO]]. In the first year and months of his tenure, Manchester City has cut its losses in half <ref name=bloomberg>{{cite news |title=Manchester City Halves Annual Loss as Revenue Rises to Record |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-01-29/manchester-city-halves-annual-loss-as-revenue-rises-to-record.html |work=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]] |date=30 January 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2014 }}</ref> and he claims the club will break even in the 2013-14 season.<ref name=daily>{{cite news |title=City confident they can break even next year and comply with financial fair play rules |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2548265/Manchester-City-confident-break-year-comply-financial-fair-play-rules.html |work=[[Daily Mail]] |date=29 January 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2014 }}</ref> Soriano replaced Manager [[Roberto Mancini]] with [[Manuel Pellegrini]] and tasked him to win “five trophies in five years”.<ref name=guardian>{{cite news |title=Manchester City tell Manuel Pellegrini 'win five trophies in five years' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/may/24/manchester-city-manuel-pellegrini-trophies |work=[[The guardian]] |date=24 May 2013 |accessdate=24 March 2014 }}</ref> In the same period City has bought an MLS franchise in New York to create [[New York City FC]] and an existing football club in Australia ([[Melbourne Heart FC]]) initiating the club’s expansion strategy.<ref name=expansion>{{cite news |title=Manchester City Football Club to acquire Melbourne Heart FC in partnership with owners of Melbourne Storm |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/news/club-news/2014/january/club-announcement-22-january-2014 |work=[[Manchester city|Manchester City]] |date=22 January 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2014 }}</ref>
==Controversies== In January 2013, Barcelona president [[Sandro Rosell]] claimed that "Manchester City have attempted to entice a number of staff from the [[Camp Nou]]", but added "there were no fish left".<ref name=fish>[http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2013/01/15/manchester-city-fishing_n_2477802.html "Manchester City 'Fishing' For Barcelona Staff, Says Sandro Rosell"], ''[[Huffington Post]]'', 15 January 2013</ref> Rosell alleged that the Manchester club tried, in an "offensive" approach, to sign players "from all levels of Barcelona's structure," and also other employees of the Catalan side.<ref name=fish/> These allegations were not pursued.
In February 2013, Soriano was accused by the FC Barcelona board, led by Rosell, of authorising a £1.7 million e-mail surveillance of club employees suspected of "working against" Barca's then president [[Joan Laporta]].<ref name=spy>[http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2013/02/20/ferran-soriano-spying_n_2722218.html "Ferran Soriano, Manchester City Chief Executive, Accused Of 'Spying' At Barcelona"], ''Huffington Post'', 20 February 2013</ref> In March 2014, a judge cleared Soriano of these allegations.<ref name=cleared>{{cite news |title=City chief Soriano makes leap to clearing name over Barca 'spying' allegations |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2575984/City-chief-Soriano-makes-leap-clearing-Barca-spying-allegations.html |work=[[Daily mail|Daily Mail]] |date=7 March 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2014 }}</ref>
Rosell resigned from the post of Barcelona president in January 2014, one day after a Spanish court opened an investigation into Barca's €57.1 million signing of Brazilian [[Neymar]], for an alleged "misappropriation of funds."<ref name=resigns>{{cite news |title=FC Barcelona president Rosell resigns |url=http://www.euronews.com/2014/01/24/fc-barcelona-president-rosell-resigns/ |work=[[Euronews]] |date=24 January 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2014 }}</ref> In 2017, Rosell was jailed without bail after being accused of misappropriation of funds from the €57m signing of Neymar.<ref name="ESPN coverage">[http://www.espnfc.com/barcelona/story/3133849/ex-barcelona-chief-sandro-rosell-held-without-bail-in-money-laundering-probe Ex-Barcelona chief Sandro Rosell held without bail]</ref>
In September 2014, Soriano was found guilty in Spanair’s bankruptcy case and fined with £8.6 million. In May 2016, the decision was overturned by the appeal court judges who concluded that [[Spanair]]’s executives were acting in trying to "save the company," and its subsequent bankruptcy was “fortuitous”.<ref name=bankruptcy>[http://www.irishmirror.ie/sport/soccer/soccer-news/man-city-ceo-ferran-soriano-7879804 "Man City CEO Ferran Soriano is free to practise business in Spain again after having judgement overturned"], Irish Mirror, 2 May 2016</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.lapilotanoentraperatzar.cat/ca La pilota no entra per atzar], Ferran Soriano's personal website (in Catalan)
{{The City Football Group}} {{Authority control}}

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Francisco Seeber |image = Francisco Seeber.jpg |office = [[Mayor of Buenos Aires]] |term_start = May 10, 1889 |term_end = June 4, 1890 |predecessor = [[Guillermo Cranwell]] |successor = [[Francisco Bollini (mayor)|Francisco Bollini]] |birth_date = November 15, 1841 |birth_place = [[Buenos Aires]] |death_date = {{death date and age|1913|12|13|1841|11|15}} |death_place = [[Buenos Aires]] |restingplace = [[La Recoleta Cemetery]] |party = [[National Autonomist Party]] |spouse = Fanny Agrelo |profession = Construction business owner |religion = |allegiance = [[Argentina]] |branch = [[Argentine Army]] |serviceyears = 1859 — 1866 |rank = [[Captain (Army)|Captain]] |unit = |battles = [[Battle of Cepeda (1859)]]
[[Paraguayan War]] }} '''Francisco Seeber''' (November 15, 1841 – December 13, 1913) was an Argentine military officer, businessman and [[Mayor of Buenos Aires]]. ==Life and times== Francisco Seeber was born in [[Buenos Aires]] to Sophia Taut and Magnus Seeber, both [[German Argentine]] immigrants.{{cite web|url=http://www.genealogiafamiliar.net/getperson.php?personID=I23414&tree=BVCZ|title=Francisco Seeber Taut|publisher=Genealogía Familiar}} He completed his studies in [[Hamburg]], [[Germany]], and returned in 1859. He joined the [[Argentine Army]], and fought in the [[Battle of Cepeda (1859)]] and as a Captain in the [[Paraguayan War]] in 1865 and 1866. Upon his return, he joined the editorial board of ''La Libertad'', and was elected to the [[Buenos Aires Province]] Legislature. He married Fanny Agrelo in 1868, and they had nine children. Seeber established a construction firm, Catalinas Warehouses and Pier Company, Ltd., in 1872.Cutolo, Vicente. ''Nuevo Diccionario Biográfico Argentino''. Buenos Aires: Editorial Elche, 1968. The firm obtained a municipal contract to construct the Catalina Docks (located along what later became the [[Catalinas Norte]] office park). Needing a large and steady supply of soil to level and grade the hitherto flood-prone site for the wharf, Seeber bought land in the then-desolate northwest end of the city with the intent of hauling soil to Catalinas for [[land reclamation]]. He recruited his workers mostly from [[Entre Ríos Province]]; they established a neighborhood ([[Villa Urquiza]]) there in 1887.[http://blogs.clarin.com/elrincondevillaurquiza/2008/8/26/historia-villa-urquiza/ Historia de Villa Urquiza] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091109035415/http://blogs.clarin.com/elrincondevillaurquiza/2008/8/26/historia-villa-urquiza |date=2009-11-09 }} {{es icon}} Seeber was named President of the [[Buenos Aires Western Railway]] in 1887. He commissioned the construction of the important [[Rail transport in Argentina|rail link]] between [[Córdoba, Argentina|Córdoba]] and [[Buenos Aires]]. He invested in the city's first large-scale [[department store]], ''[[Galerías Pacífico|Bon Marché]]'', and was appointed Mayor of [[Buenos Aires]] on May 10, 1889, by President [[Miguel Juárez Celman]].Rögind, William. ''Historia del Ferrocarril del Sud. 1861-1936''. Buenos Aires, 1937 He continued his immediate predecessors' emphasis on [[public works]], having 400 blocks of city streets paved, installing sanitation services in the impoverished [[La Boca]] district, establishing [[right-of-way (traffic)|right-of-way]] ordinances for the city's growing traffic, and initiating the development of what later became [[Florida Street]] (today Buenos Aires' best known [[pedestrianized street]]). He also approved plans for what, during the 1920s, became [[Diagonal Norte]] Avenue as part of larger (never realized) design for a series of diagonal avenues downtown. Another plan approved during his tenure ultimately became [[Nueve de Julio Avenue]] in the 1930s, and his administration also began or completed the creation or improvement of numerous [[city park]]s and recreational and cultural sites, among them the [[Buenos Aires Zoo]] and the [[National Historical Museum (Argentina)|National Historical Museum]]. The [[Panic of 1890]] led to Seeber's resignation on June 4, and on June 22, he traveled to [[Germany]]. He represented Argentina in the 1894 [[Universal Peace Congress]] in [[Antwerp]], where he was an early advocate for [[free trade]]. Seeber returned that year and took part in a commission to organize the nation's far-flung territories in [[Patagonia]] and the far north. Following an 1897 stay in Europe to study the organization of the [[Quartermaster]] Corps, he toured [[South America]] for an appreciation of prevailing conditions, about which he wrote in his 1903 survey, ''Argentina, Brasil, Chile, Uruguay, Perú, Bolivia y Paraguay: estudios comparativos''. Seeber, who also wrote numerous articles on his military studies in Europe, was named head of the Quartermaster's Advisory Board in Argentina. Francisco Seeber retired in Buenos Aires, and died there in 1913 at age 72. He was interred in [[La Recoleta Cemetery]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Internet Archive author|sname=Francisco Seeber}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Seeber, Francisco}} [[Category:1841 births]] [[Category:1913 deaths]] [[Category:People from Buenos Aires]] [[Category:Argentine people of German descent]] [[Category:Argentine Army personnel]] [[Category:Argentine businesspeople]] [[Category:Mayors of Buenos Aires]] [[Category:Burials at La Recoleta Cemetery]]

'''Lawrence Gavin Bertran Robinson''' (25 October 1935 – 2002) was a South African model agent in London's [[Old Bond Street]] in the 1960s and 70s who was part of the [[Swinging London]] scene. His show at Mare Moda in Capri in 1969 was described by ''The Times'' as "as zippy, as nippy and as hippy as anything seen in London's West End",<ref name=capri/> while a show for Harrods in 1970 was noted for his technique of making his models move to music like machines.
==Early life== Lawrence Robinson was from Durban, South Africa,<ref>"Diary notes", ''Southern Africa'', Volume 260 (1967), p. 117.</ref> born on 25 October 1935.<ref name=family>[https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QVZJ-Q744 Lawrence Gavin B Robinson England and Wales Death Registration Index 1837–2007.] Family Search. Retrieved 10 April 2018. {{subscription required}}</ref> He worked as a male model early in his life.<ref name=castle>Castle, Charles. (1977) ''Model Girl''. Newton Abbot: David & Charles. pp. 146-147. {{ISBN|0715374125}}</ref>
==Career== [[File:Capri BW 2013-05-14 10-41-55 DxO.jpg|thumb|Courtyard of the Certosa di San Giacomo, Capri]] In the mid 1960s, Robinson established a business as a model agent at 30 [[Old Bond Street]] in London where he traded as Gavin L. B. Robinson. According to the memoirs of [[Jo Wood]], who was signed to the agency as a teenager in the mid 1960s, it was "one of the hottest" in London at the time and Robinson was "very slim, trendy and had startlingly blond hair".<ref name=wood>Wood, Jo. (2013) ''Hey Jo''. London: HarperCollins. pp. 26-28. {{ISBN|978-0007458462}}</ref> Wood recalled that she "couldn't work out why he was so flamboyant, so ...''feminine''".<ref name=wood/> Other models on Robinson's books in the 1960s included [[Nikki Sievwright|Nikki Ross]]<ref>[http://www.modelscomposites.com/getlist.php?list=mod&choice=Nikki+Ross&year=all&id= Model Nikki Ross.] The Model Archives of Marlowe Press. Retrieved 9 April 2018.</ref> and [[Sonia Pugin]].<ref>[http://www.modelscomposites.com/fullsize.php?count=6&imgno=46486 Model Archives of Marlowe Press.] Retrieved 10 April 2018.</ref> Barbara Molyneux claimed that the first ever [[Head shot|head sheet]] was created for Robinson by Peter Marlowe by 1968.<ref>[http://www.modelscomposites.com/press.php The Marlowe Press Story.] Barbara Molyneux, Model Archives of Marlowe Press. Retrieved 9 April 2018. Originally published in ''Model Journal'', No. 6, April 1989.</ref>
In 1969, Robinson put on a show for 1,000 people in the courtyard of the [[Certosa di San Giacomo]], a [[Carthusian monastery]] in [[Capri]], for the finale of the [[Mare Moda]] festival. It was described by [[Antony King-Deacon]] of ''The Times'' as "as zippy, as nippy and as hippy as anything seen in London's West End".<ref name=capri>"Capri caprices", Antony King-Deacon, ''The Times'', 17 October 1969, p. 17.</ref> According to King-Deacon, [[Maria Antonelli (fashion designer)|Maria Antonelli]]'s models "were thrashing about with their arms and legs in a sort of frenzied apathy. On they ran, harem-scarem, wiggle, scream and they were gone." No one really saw or remembered the clothes, he complained.<ref name=capri/> Robinson also produced the finale for the 1970 Mare Moda.<ref>"Revels with the ravioli set", Prudence Glynn, ''The Times '', 29 September 1970, p. 14.</ref>
In March 1970, he put on a show at the [[Harrods]] department store titled "Return of the Blues" that King-Deacon saw as unusual in giving a major role to men's clothes, although the female models still outnumbered the men. King-Deacon praised Robinson for his ability to put on "without apparent effort a fashion show of unparalleled chic" and noted his technique of using models "as though they were machines by making them walk, turn, bend and even bat their eyelids to the beat of the music".<ref>"Showing fashion", Antony King-Deacon, ''The Times'', 13 March 1970, p. 9.</ref>Gavin continued to produce Harrods Fashion Shows throughout the 70's using many of the same models, Christer, Greg Sherriff, Brian King, Ian Buchanan, Alan McVie, Georgie, Iona Skye, Charlie Brown (former Miss South Africa) and Christian Fletcher. He Drove an old Bentley and held weekends for his models and a few photographers at his retreat "the Barn" in Horsmonden near Goudhurst, Kent. He loved cooking, collecting Owls (ceramic etc) and renovating his various houses in the Chelsea area. [11]
Robinson later traded as Gavin's Models.<ref>"Confessions of a Champagne supermodel", Helen Williams, ''Birmingham Post'', 18 February 1999, p. 10.</ref> In the mid 1970s, the male models at Gavin's were run by the former male model [[Gil Barber]].<ref name=castle/>
==Death and legacy== Robinson died in Camden, London, in 2002.<ref name=family/> In 2013, he featured as a character in Raymond Russell's novel ''Deadly Endings''.<ref name="Russell">{{cite book|author=Russell, Raymond.|title=Deadly Endings|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=CJhdDQAAQBAJ&pg=PT51|year=2013|publisher=Raymond Russell|location=Great Britain|isbn=978-1-62675-447-8|page=51}}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Robinson, Gavin}}
